text: Hanh was a referral from a friend. She was very highly recommended. In fact, we had someone in mind but after we met her, Hanh had to be our realtor. She understood immediately what we were looking for on our first home. During the whole process, Hanh was very informative, knowledgeable, professional, positive, and on point. Within about 2 months, we closed our home. She answered texts, calls, and emails very fast. She met with us on last minute calls, any day of the week. We feel very blessed to have such a great person to work with. Hanh made sure we were offering the write amount and not what the seller wanted. I cannot say anything bad about her. I would definitely recommend her if you are looking for someone that is passionate and truthful to her job.

text: Chris was always in contact with us and answered all questions we had about the property, even after we bought the property Chris was extremely helpful. I would recommend Chris for any future  real estate needs.

Jane Memory White

name: Lori Marie
text: After our home was for sale for over a year with Coldwell Banker, we decided to go with RaJane. Thank God we did...she sold our home in less than 2 weeks! We were finally able to move back home to VA. It was a big mistake on our part not listing with RaJane in the first place. She didn't just list our home in the MLS and sit back while other realtors showed our house to buyers who couldn't even get a bank loan, like Coldwell Banker did...RaJane actually got out there and actively found a qualified buyer! Wonderful realtor! We recommend her highly!!

text: Over the last several years, i have had the privilege of working with Rajane and her husband Mark on many projects.  As a home inspector, i am exposed to a lot of agents but Rajane is definitively at the top of her game.   Good business woman, fair to a fault and a genuine Southern Lady.  I try my best to be impartial, but she stands in my top five favorites. Five stars is the most i can give, but i'd like to do better.  Listing or Selling, Rajane deserves your attention when you are looking for a hard working, productive real estate professional.

text: My experience with a realtor at this office was a nightmare, I listed my country place in August 2018, in January of 2019 I was ready to take it off market but was told that a couple who had previously looked at it had sold their house and was ready to buy mine, so I signed a contact to sell , a short time later I was informed that they had issues with selling their place and was gonna have to go to court, I was not given an option to get out of the contract ,, I suffered from January 31 to May 15 , wondering and waiting always told they were gonna buy, I had moved out of my house , sold things I can never get back, tore my life apart , I am 67 and my husband 69, in the end of this miserable contract they did not buy and we received NO COMPENSATION for our torment,,we now have to try to put our home back together and we are heartsick over the way we were treated by this office and realtor ,,BEWARE when signing a contract we were totally mislead by our agent at this office

name: Kelsey Marek
text: Words can't even describe how WONDERFUL  our experience was. My husband and I purchased our first home this month. We used Pam Files as our realtor and Cindy Morrison for the lending process. Both ladies are from this office. We had heard so many horror stories of how hard it is to get to the closing table and how much of a head ache it is. Hands down, Cindy blew that rumor out of the water. This super woman had us ready to close in less than a month! Cindy works really hard and really fast to get the job done. It was as easy as pie lol. And Pam, this woman is so sweet and lovely but, don't let that fool you. She can get tough if need be to get the job done. We had issues with our builders making MANY mistakes and dragging out the closing date. Pam wouldn't let up on them till they got the job done right! Pam was so caring during the hunt for our home and helped us through the entire process. She was there to answer our questions whenever we had them. She has a great eye for detail and noticed things I never would have noticed when looking at homes. She really took notice to what I like and what I was looking for in a home. She read my personality well. We finally found the home of our dreams (a french country spec home). We were not expecting to deal with problems from the building company but we did. As soon as problems started to arise I thought I would become extremely stressed out but Pam stepped in and handled everything. I am truly thankful for everything Pam and Cindy did for us. I can't wait to get our house settled and decorated so I can invite these two ladies to our home warming party. We would not be in such a lovely home had it not been for these two wonderful ladies holding our hands through the entire process. Thank you so much Pam and Cindy!!! You two are like family to us now. I will definitely recommend you guys to everyone I know who is looking to buy a house or refinance. <3

name: Ur mOm
text: Run! This complex has no quiet hours. My coworker lives here currently and comes to work every day with severe lack of sleep issues due to the noise in her apartment. Granted the people who live upstairs are not maliciously creating noise, but any apartment complex should know that you don't put a family of 6 or more above a single person. I can confidently say that her living conditions are unbearable because I have heard it first hand. It is difficult to carry on a conversation in her apartment because of either the bed squeaking throughout the night or the children running from room to room late into the night and early mornings. If you need to sleep during the night or early mornings and your upstairs neighbors feel differently you are at their mercy for the duration of your lease. Beware!

name: Andrew In
text:
Please disregard Alabama Crappie Adventures's review, that person does not even live here. I have been living in this location for about 4 months now, but I would like to say that for the cost, this place is worth every penny.

I live in a 2 bed 1 bath location, and the management is very helpful if you have any issues. Just go and talk to them.

Also Spectrum has 200 Mbps going through here so the internet speed is also amazing.

If there is a issue, they always get it fixed. Also did I tell you that this exit on the 65 is where the back up usually starts when going home at 5? so that you can avoid that also if possible!

Also they have the best inset control as well, only saw one roach so far but it was dead. I believe he got through when I left the door open, but just to let you know it died so all is well that ends well.

text:
I have known Hobert Pruitt for some time – I cannot recommend Hobert highly enough!
Hobert is highly knowledgeable in the North Alabama area.  He has lived here for many years and lived in Morgan County all his life.  He knows the ins-and-outs of buying and selling homes, and is incredibly flexible and accommodating in scheduling viewings.    He is very patient and generous in giving detailed feedback and notes in reading through HOAs (which he has great expertise in reviewing) and contracts, pointing me in a good direction with lenders, helping set realistic expectations throughout the process, and basically guided me through every step of the way.    He is very professional and responded quickly whether by email or text.  Also important to me was the fact that he put absolutely no pressure on me and provided information in an even-handed, non-judgmental, manner, and was unfazed by several course-changes in what I was looking for.  Bottom line – I can’t imagine having a more positive experience and recommend him without reservation to anyone looking to buy in this stressful market.  Thanks Hobert!

text: It seems to me that he only rents to the middle class and upper class white folks! Not only are his staff rude, but unprofessional! And it seems that they don't rent to people that work and make a honest living, your credit shouldn't be the only qualifying factor in renting from this company! But it is, not to mention being African American.

name: Scarlett Vinson
text: My husband and I have been renting with Tom West since March of 2016. From the beginning, the women that work there were very short and snooty with us, especially a young girl that worked at the front at the desk with short brown hair. Her nose was so far in the air, I don't even know if she knew what earth looked like. I got the vibe of "I'm better than you". No one is better than anyone no matter how much money you make, or what you wear, or what you do for a living. We haven't really had that many issues except a few. First of all, we own a dog. A well trained amazing dog. When we saw the house at first, the carpet was terrible. There was a huge black stain on the carpet in the living room and it was coming up at the seams in some places. You could tell the carpet was cheap and old and quite frankly plain nasty. They (owners/tom west) refused to replace the carpet because we had a dog. Also, the kitchen tile was terrible and in some places of the house, you could tell needed to be replaced. Second, We called Tom West a couple months back about a bed bug infestation. When we moved in, we had noticed little bugs a few places, but in the lease agreement, it stated we were to take care of pest control, not realizing they were bed bugs. We did not have bed bugs at our apartment and had verification from the previous landlord. We never called until about a year later when we couldn't get rid of them and they refused to pay to get them removed after we had tried just about everything. Its laughable now because we are moving out and they are still going to have to pay to remove them. Also, in the moving out procedures, you have to pay to get the carpet cleaned. They want me to have that cheap, stained carpet to get professionally clean knowing they are probably going to remove it anyways. We brought our newborn into this home thinking this could be our home for a bit, and now we are moving out 7 months later because it's just what's best. Over all, I would say the company is ok, but pick them last if you have to. When I rent again, they will be last on my list of companies to go through just mainly because of customer service and not taking care of their customers the way it should be and maybe it has a lot to do with the owners of the property as well in which case they need to be realistic as well.

name: Donna Harbert
text: I've never been so upset at one company in my entire life. I rented a home that was left in wonderful condition! 1 small repair and 1 blind was all that I had trouble taking care of before I left. I asked the front clerk the day I was turning my keys in if I could purchase a new pair of blinds and drop them off or even borrow the key to replace them myself because I wanted to do the right thing... she so RUDELY told me she would have to charge me another day. As a customer coming to you and WANTING to do the right thing, I was beyond upset to know this was so rudely handled. My security deposit that was mailed to me is literally NOT EVEN a quarter of what I paid up front because of the "repairs & blinds installment" I was charged for. I will never ever again deal with this scam company who rips people off and so rudely present themselves to their customers. I also will never recommend them. If you pay a security deposit with them and leave them with a decent home as when you moved in, don't expect your deposit back. They will find "repairs" to get you with. Completely & utterly disgusted with this company. Worst in Dothan.

name: Cornelius Clark
text: Tom West is probably one of, if not,  the biggest company in the Dothan area when it comes to renting or buying homes in the area. For starters the customer service in the main office is by far the WORST I have ever dealt with. Everyone is short and snobby especially the females that work at the front desk. I was renting one of their properties for close to 5 years. I travel a lot with my job and that was the only reason I stayed there so long. When I moved in I immediately had issues with things that were suppose to be done but wasn't. Had issues with things breaking and not working properly. It took forever to get some one out to take care of the issues. Then I move out and I have to get the carpets cleaned and provide a receipt only to be told that the carpets weren't good enough and they would have to have the company they use to come out and clean it again and charge it to me. They will not do a walkthrough inspection with the tenant before moving out. Then as I expected, my $575 security deposit is taken for painting the townhouse, so called repairs and cleaning. I paid to have the place cleaned as well but they have no plans on returning your security deposit. They make up whatever they can with no explanation. Just a horrible company to work with and I would NEVER recommend to anyone..Avoid at all cost. I notice all the 1 star reviews with the one 5 star review...that had to be a mistake!!! If I could give 0 stars I would!!!!!

name: Brooke Kelley
text: Horrible customer service. They do not take care of their properties or rental customers. We were told upon moving in to do a walk through and make a list of things that were wrong. We did, and we took pictures and gave them a list of about 15 issues we noticed. We rented a property from them for a year and in that year they fixed one thing off our list. Upon moving out we followed all procedures listed in our rental agreement. Most of the things on our list upon moving in we were charged for when moving out!!!! On top of that they made things up along the way in order to keep our initial deposit of $1150.00. They said that the property had leaks, mold and that we didn’t turn in the keys and garage door opener all of which was untrue. We did not receive ANY of our deposit back plus they tried to tell us we owed an additional $500 +! When we called to tell them to take it out of the deposit they kept they informed us that it was over and beyond that. Then they changed their story to say that when we didn’t turn in our keys(which we did) that we forfeited our security deposit?! When we asked what the additional money was for we also got a different story every time we called....first it was for removal of items(we left hangers 🙄) then it was for carpet cleaning....call me crazy but last time I checked neither of these cost 1600 dollars! They then sent us invoices that they had that they said we were being charged for cleaning fees???! Entire house was cleaned and left in better shape than when we moved in. Funny thing being, the three invoices they sent for the work done which was all minor cleaning around the house didn’t even total 500.....do not rent from these lying thieves that cannot keep their stories straight!!!!

name: Christina Roach
text: My Husband and I have been displaced by Hurricane Michael; and, have been seeking for a home in the Dothan area. We found two homes that met our budget and what we’ve been looking for from their listings. A Ms. Powell, with Tom West Company of Dothan, told us it would be a $40 application fee for each of us (there are 3 of us) to seek Rental.  She took our money and called us that afternoon to say we were denied because of credit. Didn’t considered we were displaced; or, anything else for that matter. I’ve been working for Lowe’s for over 20 years; and, my Husband has been self-employed for the past 8 years. My Mom is retired. They didn’t take anything else in consideration, only the fact our credit wasn’t appealing to them. Can’t believe you’ll judge someone based on their financial credit. We’re not buying a house; we’re renting a house. Shoot one of the Houses appeared to have been vacant for quite some time. I can see that, especially the way Tom West Company manages properties, especially when it comes to renting to people. Even though we’ve been taking advantage of despite our unfortunate situation, we will prevail; because, God will open a door for us. He always does.

text:
We met Duffy as the selling agent of a house we scheduled a tour for in our preferred search area. During the tour, she was extremely professional, wore PPE, offered sanitizing wipes, and it became obvious to us that she knew our preferred area very well. Her thoughtfulness and knowledge made her an easy choice for us when our dream home hit a very competitive market. She immediately went to work. Because of her late-night efforts and quick work, we had an approved offer literally overnight! Things were moving so quickly, we are absolutely positive that we would have missed out on the opportunity to own this new home without her at the wheel. From there, Duffy always offered to help and oblige us when schedules conflicted and details became more difficult in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

All in all, Duffy Stewart knows her stuff, she’ll do whatever it takes to help you as her client, and she will get results!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Casey. As you've experienced, local knowledge and speed are important traits in this fast-paced market. Duffy knows her stuff and we couldn't be more thrilled to have you as a happy client. Thank you for putting your trust in Duffy and BHHS.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

name: Scott Spearman
text:
I was offered a job and found out I was moving to Birmingham in November of last year. The problem was, I knew nothing of the "Magic City" or its neighborhoods. But on the same day I received the offer for the new job, I realized I needed to find a place, and fast. So I downloaded an apartment app and started searching. I had decided on one criteria. I wanted to walk to work.  That should be easy, I thought, there are a tone of loft apartments downtown. The problem is that the large majority of them were black boxes. To this day. I don't know how one would go about taking a look at and discovering availability on these lofts. Without being overly conspiratorial, I will say that to this day I have doubts about the ethics, motives and business practices of so many of these downtown apartments. I still don't know how to crack those black boxes. There was one huge exception. There was a company that managed a couple of downtown lofts that were located less than a five minute walk from my workplace. When I called them and left a message, they called me back in less than 5 minutes. So that same day, I arranged to meet with their guy, Andrew, who would show me some two-bedroom lofts available at both Goodall-Brown and Fix Play. I immediately fell in love with the 3rd floor loft that would become my home for the next year. I loved the rooftop lounge and the apartment's Modern Amenities with exposed brick, 14 ft ceilings with exposed pipes and ducts and beautiful original hardwood floors, as well as my favorite feature, "the stairs to nowhere", which became my meditation space, is all I needed to remind me I was not living in an apartment "complex". I was home.

I would be remiss if I didn't mention the fact that as someone with a less-than-perfect credit score, Goodall-Brown lofts management company, SPM, was great to work with to get my contract through and approved, as they provide options that most companies do not. They also offered me free rent for the remainder of the month, which I totally took advantage of.  In a few weeks I was moved

Although I am not a dog owner, I have really enjoyed getting to know my neighbors and their furry friends. They both, the neighbors and their pets, were amicable and friendly as we constantly ran into each other in the elevator.

I also think the  Goodall Brown Lofts are in the absolutely best location to make the most of downtown living in Birmingham. Within 1 block you can walk to El Barrio, Bamboo, Atomic Lounge and Collins bar. Heck, the Wine Loft is in the SAME BUILDING. Within 4 blocks you can add more than a dozen other fantastic bars and restaurants, like Queens Park, Paramount, East West, The Florentine, John's City Diner, The Essential, Pilcrow, Cayo Coco. I have drank or dines at every one of these places and have yet to be disappointed.

In regards to the management company, I'll never forget that time a few months that I accidentally dropped my keys down the door crack  of the elevator shaft. (Don't ask, but I could hear them banging all the way down to the first floor) Sheepishly I put in a maintenance request on the website and then followed up with a  phone call the next day. Only a day later, Paris, the delightful general manager for SPM, who is a busy lady responsible for a handful of properties, knocked on my door, my keys in hand. She had had to call the elevator company to retrieve them.  I asked her how much I owed her for that service. She waved my question away. "It's fine", she said. Needless to say, they are a responsive company when it comes to service calls

I decided in October that I wanted a bigger place and preferably a house. So I found the perfect place and have moved out of Goodall-Brown  as of early December. I know that it was the right decision for me, but that doesn't change the fact that I miss my beautiful loft and the fun of downtown living.

resp.text: Scott, thank you for this truly thoughtful five-star review of Goodall-Brown Lofts! We know you had many choices when looking for your first home in The Magic City, and we couldn't be happier knowing you enjoyed your time with us. Our team would like to offer their sincere thanks for your kind words regarding their service. It is always our pleasure to provide prompt and meaningful assistance to our wonderful residents. We are often told our ideal location is a favorite feature and are delighted you found it convenient for work and play. Though we were sorry to see you go, we wish you the best with your new house! If you are ever looking to return to loft living, we would love to welcome you home. Please feel free to reach out anytime.

name: j b
text:
Certainly not writing this review out of pettiness, but more on principle because I feel like this situation was handled very poorly by the business owner. We did business with SRG in buying a printer from them. I know it’s not a home or property, but if they were this bad to deal with over a $45 printer, I’d be hard pressed to work with them over a $250k home.

We were told that it was in working condition, but needed toner. We met Tabitha to pick up the printer and then spent $53 on toner. We should’ve been good to go.

Alas, the printer was missing a piece that was removed when they took their toner. A problem that should be easy to solve. We reached out to Elyse, the girl who arranged the purchase to no avail. I called and left a message for Tabitha with no returned call. I emailed Tabitha and she responded once asking what wasn’t working. I even sent pictures of the missing piece. No response. We reached out every few days and both Elyse and Tabitha stopped responding all together. We had asked to either bring the printer back or have them buy the piece for us.

It was only a $20 piece, but we bought the dang thing after being told that it should work and it didn’t. $115 later (about 3x the purchase price) and we had a working printer.

Screenshots of our conversations available upon request.

resp.text: Jacob - I appreciate your feedback but this has absolutely nothing to do with Superior Realty Group as this printer belonged to someone who works at Superior, Elyse. She listed it for sale on her personal Facebook page and negotiated the sale, pickup etc. I can attest that her printer was working when she unplugged it and moved it to our new office. I met you at our office where the printer was as a favor to her because she lives over 25 minutes away. Superior Realty Group has a stellar reputation and neither I nor my company have ever received any negative reviews for our customer service and knowledge of the real estate market. I ask that you remove this review immediately as it is not a reflection of myself or my real estate company. I did not receive the money from the sale of this printer and had nothing to with the transaction other than it took place at my office. Everyone that works in my office is a subcontractor and supplies their own computers and equipment. It was never implied that the printer had toner in it so that was an expense you should have expected and you paid her $45 for the printer which was $15 less than she was asking for it. I see you are now trying to sell it for $70 and state it "works great. Prints fast and efficiently." Remove this fraudulent review immediately! - Tabitha, Broker/Owner of Superior Realty Group Inc a 5-star Real Estate Brokerage.

After closing, Mike kept in touch with us to make sure pre-contract repairs were progressing and everything was getting resolved to our satisfaction; even when things went wrong that a realtor couldn’t possibly have any control over (leaking fridges and dishwashers) Mike was on hand to provide advice and recommendations.

His friendly nature and calm response to things we considered potentially disastrous gave us great peace of mind throughout the entire process from first viewing, to moving in, and finally finding time to sit in my new home-office to write this testimonial.

We would strongly recommend Mike Hamm to anyone who is looking for an honest, friendly, knowledgeable realtor.

text: I bought my current house and sold the previous one using Eddy Harris at Expert Realty.  Very good, professional work by them.  On the sale they put up a sign showing my house was coming soon. He actually found me the perfect house that had not even posted a for sale sign yet.  The house was presented as a for sale by owner.  That didn't matter to Eddy.  He still arranged a showing and  prepared the offer contract for me and did all the things a listing agent would do associated with a buyer client.  In fact he even stayed on top of things with the seller to make sure things he was contractually obligated to do were handled properly.  Great job by Eddy and his staff at Expert Realty.

name: Janita Ball
text: Where to start??!! Nicholette Boyer was our Superhero in our search for a first home. My husband and I were both clueless as to how this process worked and we took her all over county lines looking at houses, but she never complained. She showed up with a smile. Nicholette consistently sent us potential listings and if we wanted to view a home she would have the viewings set up ASAP. She is a sweetheart who is so personable. I don't take to people easily, but I LOVE Nicholette. She kept everyone in our process in check and made sure that they were working in our best interest. The stress of this process is insurmountable and (needless to say) my husband and I cracked a few times. She hung in there with us and didn't judge us at all (well if she did we didn't know). She is very professional and such a sweet lady. I'm a tough critic but Nicholette definitely delivered. She went out of her way to acknowledge our emotions, address our concerns, and help lower our stress levels. WE found our little slice of the American Dream with Nicholette's help and close today! If you want a hard-working realtor who will go to bat for you and keep you informed throughout the process I HIGHLY recommend Nicholette. You won’t regret using her!

resp.text: Thank you for your detailed, candid, 5-star review! Congratulations on your Closing Day! We wish you countless beautiful memories in your first home.

name: Chris Anthony
text: My daughter attended Auburn University and graduated last spring.  We had purchased a condo in Donahue Crossing, and following her graduation it was time to sell.  Living out of state, I knew it would be a challenge to do all that needed to be done to make that happen.  I contacted Weichert Realtors, (after not getting calls returned from 2 other Auburn realtors) and was referred to Sherry Adcock.  She met me at the condo, educated me on the Auburn market and then helped me determine what I needed to do to get the best price and sell it quickly.  She assisted me with every detail, and coordinated contractors access to the property.  Her recommendations were spot on, every time.  The sale closed today, just over 6 weeks after our first conversation.  You can't go wrong with Sherry and the folks at Weichert Realtors Porter Properties!!!

text: Horrible experience with realtor Viki Yaron.  She was insulting and rude in her counter offers to me.  Business is business keep your feelings and opinions to yourself add libing about the seriousness of the buyer or what the buyer can or cannot afford, in your opinion, are just that, your opinion.  Bullying tactics do get  people to buy and I will never recommend this realtor to anyone!  One bad apple can spoil a bunch and am reluctant to view any other properties listed through this realty company, but I WILL NOT be viewing any properties she has listed!!

resp.text:
Ms. Pare,
As Broker of our company I take great pride in promoting professionalism by all of our Realtors.

I apologize for the fact you feel you were not treated properly in a recent real estate negotiation. Seeing as you were not a direct client of our office but working through another Realtor in purchasing one of our listings I think some things were lost in translation and probably could have been handled more tactfully.

I have spoken with Viki Yaron and she realizes some of the negotiation could have been better handled speaking directly with your Realtor in order to explain her client’s counteroffer. Please feel free to call me anytime at our office if you like to discuss further.

Stacey Sanders, Broker

name: stalexis glenn
text: I moved in Friday 8/9/19. Upon moving in my air wasn’t working, called and they said they would send some one out. 2 maintenance men came out but my air wasn’t fixed. When i called back they said they would not come out unless it was 85 degrees or more. They did not fix my air until 8/10/19 after i called that morning and told them i was hot and someone needed to fix my air that day. Second problem on my move in day, my tub was clogged. I put a work request in on 8/9/19 no one has yet to come out. I called 8/10/19 they said they will mark it urgent & someone would be out that day. 8/10/19 i took a shower & the water did not run out i had to scoop dirty water out & flush down the toilet. I called 8/11/19 & 8/12/19 about the tub being clogged and they said someone would fix it that day. I come home from work 8/12/19 and it is still a tub full of dirty water. I call the maintenance line and he said he would mark my request urgent and send the on call maintenance man to my apartment ASAP. As the air conditioning man was fixing the air in another apartment he knocks mine out somehow i called about that also. So the on call maintenance man calls me and says that he tried to come out but didn’t have a key to my apartment so i asked him what i was suppose to do about a shower and he said “the best i can do is be there in the morning”. AFTER i was told it would be fixed today. Cable line are ran from the upstairs apartments to the bottom. I asked if he fixed my cable he said the line was cut and spectrum was coming out tomorrow. I called spectrum and they had no record of this. Then he said the air conditioning man would be out & i am STILL without air. Moral of the story they will tell you anything to TRY to keep you happy. It has been problem after problem after problem and i have not been here a WEEK YET. My air is still out, my tub is still clogged, i still do not have my cable & WiFi hooked up. I WOULDN’T RECOMMEND TO MY WORST ENEMY!!!!

name: Leandria Goodson
text: They are probably by far the worst people to rent from. Been a tenant with them for many years and it did not start off this way. What I love best about them is the maintenance department who first of all doesn't "fix" anything..they will "patch" things up and give you a bogus maintenance charge when you report the issue to them again. Oh and not to mention the person who handles the maintenance requests is a real joy to deal with over the phone, as this person is rude and very unprofessional.  Something else that I truly love about them is how they will send you bogus late fees  if you don't keep up with when you paid them and how much. My advice to any new tenant is to keep copies of your rent payments and if you pay online take screenshot of the paymment confirmation.

text: This company IS BY FAR the BEST rental company I have rented from. From day ONE...Victoria, Amy, and Sarah have been EXCEPTIONAL. name: Jackie Brown
text: This one of the worst property management companies in Birmingham. If you have no other choice, Red Rock Realty is just for you! They do not follow tenant leasing laws. They don’t do anything to solve problems, if anything they create more. You’ll make a complaint they will listen to you and sympathize but they will not be proactive in solving any situation dealing with disturbances of a neighbor. They also tried to say I didn’t pay my rent which was not true my bank statements said other wise. Instead of trying to help they will manipulate a situation trying to force you out from where you can afford to live. If you have 15 people that need a place to stay in a one bedroom rent from Red Rock Realty, they have no capacity limitations. You’ll have a Red Rock time. Remember Red Rock is just a stone covered in blood.

name: Alicia Sherman
text:
Brad Clay stated they do not accept out of state guarantors, even if they provide a year's rent upfront.  I am unsure how this is at all beneficial to them unless they are attempting to keep a certain kind of tenant from renting their properties.

Food for thought.

Edit to respond to owner's comment:

Thank you for your quick response!  If only your responses were this timely when reporting a problem in one of your units!  Let's be clear that I did not accuse you of anything, merely stated that this was the only logical reason I could conclude for not accepting a year's rent upfront.  While there are other issues I could address, I think your yelp and google reviews speak for themselves.

resp.text:
Ms. Sherman,
We have been advised by our attorney not to accept out-of-state guarantors because of the cost associated with holding those guarantors accountable.  We do allow tenants to pay rent in advance but this does not circumvent our standards to confirm a resident’s ability to provide income showing they have the ability to pay rent.  To make accusations online that we are discriminating is wrong and unfair.  We are an equal-housing opportunity provider and work with every applicant equally on qualifications.

Thank you,

text: I've been in one of the properties for a while now I have to say that it has been a fair stay as long as you don't need them for anything.. What I don't like is that you can never get anyone on the phone, maintenance takes their time to fix things and let not mention you can never get the person over the phone to return phone calls. The washers in the washroom work sometimes.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We honestly do our best to answer all calls and greet each person, however if you ever have an issue please feel free to email us at: Leasing@redrockrg.com or info@redrockrg.com.  You can also contact us through the Online Portal.  If you don't have access to it or have misplaced it, email us and we can send you a link to reset.  Thank you!

name: Chris Burgett
text: I want to first say that I love how quiet our apartment is and the location. I enjoy that it is one level and no one is above or below us. The one thing, and it's a HUGE PROBLEM, something that I told them about right after moving into said apartment about is the carpet. I mentioned that it was filthy and the owner of Red Rock persisted to state that it had been professionally clean. And after talking to our neighbor I believe this to be true. But the previous owners were disgusting and I don't know what they did to it but even after us buying a high dollar, well made carpet cleaner ourselves and cleaning it TWICE we still cannot walk across the carpet without our feet being sticky and them nor or socks being BLACK. This makes me sick to my stomach. We should be able to walk on our carpet without this being an issue. We have a three year old and I feel disgusted knowing it will never been clean. We only moved in the last week of October and I hate knowing we have to deal with this problem indefinitely. It has torn places and places where it is coming apart in two areas in a line that will only get worse. You guys KNEW the last tenant was fifthly and knowing that should have just replaced the carpet so no one else had to deal with it. I believe it needs to be pulled up and something else put down ASAP. I know that if it is not that we will be moving out, instead of staying put (as we had hoped to do) as soon as our year is up. That is a shame because otherwise we love it.

name: Julie Wilson
text: My air conditioner went out last night (10/4). We have placed several calls through the maintenance line with promises of someone getting in touch with us ASAP. We haven’t heard a single thing. This is Alabama in the middle of summer. It’s HOT. I would never recommend these people to anyone.

name: Laura Puckett
text:
I applied for an apartment about three months ago. I paid the application fee ($90)  and waited for their call. When I finally received the call (after more than a week, rather than the 3-4 day waiting period they promised), I was told someone had applied before me, so they received the apartment. Things happen, and I was okay with this news. The woman I spoke to on the phone said they would have another apartment available at the same location in two weeks time. That's great! She said they would call me as soon as it was available, and I would be the first person on the waiting list.
Three weeks go by. I call to check on it after hearing nothing. This time I'm told they don't know what date the apartment will be available---not even a time estimate.
Fast forward three months. No updates. At first I called once a week, and they typically answered the phone, though they were NEVER able to offer a time estimate on the apartment. For the past month, I'm lucky to ever get a person on the phone--instead I have to leave voicemails that have only been answered once.
And now the voicemail box is full. They never answer. I was patient to begin with, but I specifically halted apartment hunting for the apartment they originally said would be ready two weeks after I applied.
I'm so disappointed with this experience. If you are in a time crunch and must have an apartment quickly, please don't use this company.
I am lucky to have found a much nicer place to live, with much more helpful staff. I'm leaving this review in the hopes that someone will completely avoid this realty company, rather than wasting three months on them with no results and down $90, like I did.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Puckett,
We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience with our team at Red Rock and apologize.  Please know that we have two new great leasing staff members that have just joined our team this last week and we would love to have the opportunity to try regain your business.  We can assure you that you will have a completely different experience.  Again, we sincerely apologize for not assisting as we should have.

Sincerely,
Brad Cleage
Red Rock Realty Group

name: Nathan Joly
text:
Worst realty company I have ever had to deal with. Was treated horribly because of my skin color. My girlfriend put in her application for an apartment which basically got approved but her boss wouldn't verify employment over the phone (that's okay and a safe thing to do). Instead of letting her know of the problem, she received no notification. She called to find out days later about the status of her application because she heard nothing from them at all and was told of the problem. For a company needing to fill spots, since empty spots cost money instead of make money, this is a very horrible way for employees to be. When she put in her deposit and we asked about a receipt, we were told the receipt from the money order was enough (the tear off tab). I guess receivership of money doesn't require a receipt for this company or Brittany doesn't understand how a receipt actually works. Every other company we've rented from gives a receipt as proof of receiving a deposit (Arizona, California, Florida, Virginia). Very sketchy. Not a company we want to deal with.
Update (20181106): The response to my review was horrible. Your core values don't mean a thing if there is no true follow-up to a problem so it can be corrected. I am in the U.S. Air Force and one of our core values are Integrity First. This company posted a advertisement as a 5 star review. There is no integrity there as they stated in their core values.

Ms. King,
After you spoke with one of our principals on the phone to file your complaint on 2/4/19, they reviewed the video of your visit to Red Rock on that day.  The account of your visit given to our principal and the one that you give in your review is not accurate.  We saw no confrontation between you and our leasing agent and our other agent was on the phone assisting a customer during your visit.  We welcome reviews of Red Rock, both positive and negative, as they help us grow as a company.  However, we do not appreciate when needless comments are directly personally towards our staff.  It is our goal to provide the best customer service possible, but sometimes we may fall short of some visitor’s expectations.  We apologize that your visit was not inviting and we do hope that it will be on your next visit.   After your visit and review, we have discussed with our leasing staff the importance of maintaining a welcoming and inviting environment for all who visit Red Rock.

name: Timothy Astor
text:
Please do yourself a favor and rent with another company in Birmingham. This is one of the most disorganized and frustrating realty companies I have ever had the displeasure of having to work with. The shame is that the apartment itself is quite nice, even if it wasn't cleaned before I moved in.

Initially, after Red Rock tried to overcharge me, I was charged twice for my security deposit. Then, when moving in, I was told that the only way to pay my first month's rent was through security deposit and that I had to drop it off in person at their office. What a thoroughly archaic way to collect rent! On top of the fact that their office hours prevent you from actually getting to their office if you have a full time job. Regarding their hours, even if you call while they are supposedly open, never once have they actually answered the phone. And good luck receiving a timely callback if you leave a message, as it takes at least a week for them to respond.

Fast forward two months, and I receive a notice of 2 months back rent due plus a late fee and my security deposit. Not only have they lost the record of my security deposit, they failed to note that they already charged me TWICE for it. After spending 2 days on the phone and numerous assurances from multiple employees there that everything is settled, I hope it doesn't happen again. Next month comes along, and I am told I am being threatened with eviction due to $1300+ back rent missing from their records. I am still awaiting a call back regarding this new report of incompetence.

This company is absolutely horrible when it comes to organization. The only person who has been helpful at their office, Jordan, appears to be the only competent one there, but the issues still keep piling on. If looking to rent in Birmingham, DO NOT look here.

Update: I still have bedbugs and I am still being bitten 3 weeks later. They have “treated” my unit twice & its not helped at all. Plus I found out the lady next door had bedbugs in November & the man above me has had them too but they claim he doesn’t have them anymore. I moved in towards the end of Feb & the bites popped up towards the end of March which means these bugs were still here well before I moved in & they didn’t treat it properly. I’ve decided to just move and they refuse to give my security deposit back but I don’t even care. I’ll rather live in a clean, safe environment. The name of these apartments are KINGS DREAM.

text: I have been a resident at the signal hill apartments for almost two years now and if I could give them a no star rating I would. I have been a great tenant, paying rent on time or early, no issues with other neighbors. The maintenance team seems to like to neglect their tenants. I have had water issues personally with water coming up thru my carpet to the vent in the bathroom leaking. To hearing about water it self leaking thru the walls in other apartments. To an upstairs neighbor being out of town with a leaking toilet that then started leaking in another apartment below them and maintenance taking days to show up and fix their issue. March of 2017 I called about water coming up thru my carpet and took me calling multiple times to “fix” said issue. In the past year I have had multiple sinus infection I now feel I can tie the missing link to mold that was never properly taken care of. Now I have tested positive for mold in both my living room and bedroom. I did an air test kit myself, so I now know and have proof of it. (Can’t see it but can smell it)  I assume they’re having issues believing me because I’m unable to see it. I have tried breaking my lease this past Friday on 25 May 2018 and asked them to honor my 30 day notice instead of a 60 day notice due to mold and it seems they have issues honoring that and want me to stay the full 60 days. I came in today may 29 with my mold test kits and am still waiting to hear back from the owner. I am not trying to cause issues, I just want to be able to leave and move on with my life to better my health. I am aware there are no laws in the state of Alabama that cover mold but the fact that they are so money hungry that they are willing to put their tenants health at risk for their rent money. I am very displeased with this company. I will never go thru them again.

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: Red Rock Rock managed Sherman Oaks in Eastlake for a private individual his name is Mark. Read the reviews online. I moved into an apt and 3 days later the worst odor I ever smelt in my life and I had to suffer it for 3 1/2 months before the owner would come out and he was so low down he came out when I wasn't there and removed a dead animal from a crawl space. I saw a dead possum at the end of my building. I made numerous calls & Mark the owner  never  do you need anything  for over 3 months He didn't care. the landlord reduced me to being crazy after the Health Inspector had been to my house twice and sent two letters. The owner said that the letter from the health inspector was not true. I spend a lot of money on Lysol and other products to camouflage the odor and kill the bacteria. the owner to this day still thinks that I don't deserve a dime. and he thinks that he should further punish me by holding my security deposit 5 wks. I have now learned that constructive eviction is not for the tenant it is it is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you out of your money. Unless you dead or half dead at least in Birmingham Alabama. I finally got the owner to release me from my lease to God be the glory. online reviews or  less than 2.9 now I know why. there was a strong musty odor in the apartment as well.My my eyes would burn a lot I felt my eyeballs were melting . I had headaches & I felt something or someone was dead in the walls to this day I regret not having call the police. Oh I forgot to mention about the so-called preacher Ernest Smith resident manager. Earnest a want to be preacher told as many lies as Mark and red rock. This was the most traumatizing and horrific  ordeal  I do not wish this on anyone. After removing the dead possum from the crawl space I finally got my letter from Mark to release me out of my lease. I moved out the end of June a new tenant moved in the beginning of September. I was told by one of the neighbors a Mexican family moved in at least they had at least two months to clear the air in that particular apartment. Lets name this story the hidden secret why because the apartment was newly renovated. Grandma always said looks are deceiving . I was about a1yr  cancer survivor  and  suffer with COPD with other disabilities. The federal government declared me 100% disabled in the year 2000. Mark the owner apparently thought I was just another hood rat. I lived at 7723 Apartment B 3rd Avenue South. They waited 2 months after I left then moved in a Mexican family. I almost died in there with a stinking possum. I wasn't compensated in anyway. Constructive eviction means nothing in Alabama. Unless you lost a limb or life or a have a class action lawsuit apparently. You call a lawyer and they tell you you should and when you move they tell you to file bankruptcy that's what Jonathan at Legal Aid Society call me with. All the wild suggested that there was no way that legal aid services could assist me. Every 3 months when he's got nothing else better to do he called me stalling till statue has run out. you move they tell you they are glad that you got out of that situation but they can't help you. Calling legal aid is a waste of your doggone time. Constructive eviction as far as I can see is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you anyway they want to. When you complain they do nothing can't wait till you move don't care about the money you lost. It cost me $1,500 to move in there and $1700 for me to find another place to live. I moved twice in the same year. Everytime Jonathan at Legal Services have nothing else better to do he gives me another call with another bright idea. Is Young still trying to learn his role but I do not appreciate him calling him wasting my time acquiring the same info he got the first time stalling. Whenever you get time Google constructive eviction. Hope you have better luck than I did.

name: Billy Sprague
text: This is a SCAM. I applied for an apartment for 575 a month and make almost 100k a year with good rental history. They still denied me to make the money off the application fee. They do not even return phone calls or answer the phone. I am not sure they are even a real company. I suggest if you find a place that they manage if they are real you run as they can collect more off a few application fees per day then any apartment would be worth. Very Poor business ethics.

resp.text:
Billy,

We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We do not make money off of application fees, the fee goes to cover the background check, rental history check, credit check and the time it takes to process all of these things. We have a process to review applications and mail a letter to all of our applicants letting them know if they were approved or denied. If denied the reason will be stated in the letter. It is the law that we cannot tell you over the phone why you were accepted or denied.

Our policy is to return calls and emails with in 24 hours, but with the holidays (and recent ice/snow storm) this has been off a little. For that we apoligize. If you believe there was any confusion or fault on your application please feel free to call us at 205-324-3383, email us leasing@redrockrg.com, or come by 1425 Richard Arrington Jr. Blvd South Birmingham, AL 35205.

Thank you,
Team Red Rock

name: TennTom
text: I had a business appointment scheduled with the property manager (JA) to discuss  being added as a vendor for their company. Upon arriving 10 minutes early, the receptionist for RRRG said that he was not there and that his personal assistant did not know of a meeting being scheduled, that's because I had scheduled the meeting with him directly over the phone. The receptionist called him to let him know that I was there and he said he was on his way back to the office. 15 minutes later she tells me that she saw him pulling into the parking lot that he will be in in a moment. 10 minutes later she said that he is standing in the parking lot and is on his cell phone. Waited 15 more minutes before I finally got up and walked out of their office and left. Upon returning to my office I emailed him (trying to be courteous) to let him know that I understand that he may have been busy but I would like to reschedule our meeting. He never did try to contact me back after all the wasted time that I spent setting a confirmed appointment with him, driving to his office, and sitting in the lobby for over a half hour for our scheduled meeting. After that encounter with RRRG I am glad that he stood me up, it shows what type of people work there and I would not offer my services to that company if they begged me! I feel sorry for anyone they represent.

name: FLhogs n dogs
text:
False advertising on listings.  Unethical.  Posting houses active that are under contract, etc.  Entire matter filed with Alabama Association of Realtors.

Standard of Practice 12-8
The obligation to present a true picture in representations to the public includes information presented, provided, or displayed on REALTORS®’ websites. REALTORS® shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that information on their websites is current. When it becomes apparent that information on a REALTOR®’s website is no longer current or accurate, REALTORS® shall promptly take corrective action. (Adopted 1/07)

resp.text: ValleyMLS, of which this company is a member, requires that all listings that go under contact reflect that status change within 24 hours of ratification of such contract. This company adheres to the policy of the ValleyMLS.

name: Kyrie Laré
text: I did not choose to work with anyone from this inconsistent office but had no choice after one of their realtors bought the property I live in from rocket city property management. My rent was always due by the 6th well they changed that and did not tell me then tried to charge me 50$ extra for Jan Feb and March claiming I was late but they just took too long to deposit my checks. NOT AT ANY POINT IN TIME WAS I CONTACTED AND MADE AWARE OF ANY LATE CHARGES. I HAD TO FIND THE INFORMATION ON MY ONLINE PORTAL MYSELF 3 months later and I never got a formal letter stating that I owe anything. If you owe a business, arent they supposed to send you a letter or written notice? They are so unprofessional because not only did I get ZERO letters, in the lease it stated I was to pay 45$ for late fee not 50$ so someone is not able to ensure things are consistent in this office anymore. I would not recommend dealing with this office whatsoever. They raised my rent and took three weeks to stop a huge rain water leak I had coming through my ceiling, and let me go without a working fridge for nearly a week while leaving two fridges in the tiny apartment for two weeks for storage not able to use either one. It has just been a ridiculous experience I am hoping there is a still a decent place to rent from in this area but so far this place has done me wrong totally I got two babies under 2.  Can’t afford unnecessary extra charges, rent going up, and not having a fridge. Just ridiculous and sad. I cannot wait to move.

resp.text: Kyrie,  we are so sorry this has been your experience and we would like to be able to look into your complaint.
